Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible”
Reviews.Author: LaarsP
Reviews.Content: I really don't like to complain. But this place was remarkable. Firstly, no linen or towel service. If you want new sheets or towels, you have to take them to the front desk. A 20 per day parking charge that no one mentioned to me upon check in. how nice!! And then no parking spots available for me in their filthy, overcrowded underground garage. A call to their customer care desk resulted in them asking me if I wanted to join their priority club. The corridors were undergoing renovations and were half painted. The entire hotel smelled. The remote control for the TV didn't work. the air conditioner was loud enough to wake the dead. The shower was really good. Other than that, this place was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very bad service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: arabianman
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for couple of days in November and it was very disappointing, the rooms furniture was very very old and the amenities are in bad shape and the service was extremly bad and receptionist was rude.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: massimo70
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is good located in downtown. It has some good rates, quite clean. During the weekends it hosts a lot of kids that come in Montreal for fun. Not really suggested for family...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for long term stays”
Reviews.Author: Mia2424
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a great downtown location with close access to metro, buses and taxis. The staff is friendly and efficient. It's not luxury by any means but the apts are huge and spacious. Could it use an upgrade yes, but it's clean. There's an underground parking lot with direct access to your hotel room floor, and i believe it's $9 a day if you're staying long term. there's free washers and dryers that ares always available.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: megansworldtravel
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a traditional suite hotel room i.e. bedroom and separate sitting area then this is not for you unless you book a 2 room suite. Our "suite" consisted of a room with 2 beds, a recliner, a small round side table, a desk and chair, a fully equipped kitchen and a bathroom. Fortunately there was only 2 of us so we were able to eat using the side table and the desk however any more and we would have been using the beds as tables. The mesh fan screen above the stove had not been cleaned in I don't know how long and was full of grease and black dirt/dust and there was debris on the counter. When I brought this to the attention of the front desk nothing was done so I waited and took the mesh screen and the counter debris to the desk at check out . Not even an apology just "I will ask housekeeping!!!" On a positive note the location is great, there is a grocery store within walking distance and the beds were the most comfortable of all 3 hotels we stayed in during our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Budget stay ! Worth the money !”
Reviews.Author: Fer_and_Ju Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights - 4 people in the same apartment with 2 bedrooms and 1 sofabed in the living room. Rooms were very spacious as well as the bathroom. Kitchen facilities were appreciated - they have regular sizes fridge, stove, microwave oven and dishwasher (with soap included). Cutlery, plates, cups - all you need to cook and appreciate meals. No breakfast is offered by the hotel. Cleaning is offered only once every 7 days so no one came to our apartment for cleaning or anything related with it. Parking is available under the building with access by the lifts. Well located in an avenue that runs straight downtown. We thought Montreal was very expensive (also the hotels) so this was a nice budget option for us ! Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Economic and practical”
Reviews.Author: Marco Antonio F
Reviews.Content: Some cities in Canada (probably most of them) are really expensive, and Montreal is definitely one of them. This hotel came in handy when traveling with my family. The room had a small kitchen which helped us have quick meals, cheaper than eating out everyday. Free laundry was really helpful at the middle of my trip, just need to buy the soap, which they have in their little convenience "room", a little store with some food, drinks, medicine, soap and if I remember well, a microwave. There is an "office" room with computers and Internet, was useful since I had an MBA paper to send out and all I had was an iPad. They do have internet connection in the rooms. The floors need refurbishing. Rooms are sort of old but ok, could be cleaner. Reception is renewed and staff... the staff was simply awesome with us all the time. Any question, they would stop what they were doing and help us - call a cab, point out places in the map, recommending restaurants, etc. By the way, the hotel is really close to a little market and a bar (in another hotel), and about 3 blocks from some very good restaurants. Not far from Chinatown and you can walk (if day is nice and you don't mind walking a little) to the Old Downtown. They do have a garage if you need (charged extra). If I went to Montreal again I would compare prices to be sure, but would probably stay at Candlewood again. I definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “avoid this one”
Reviews.Author: peter c
Reviews.Content: If youdon't care about being able to read i yur hotel room at night,and donotmind smelling your next door neighbour'sdinneras it is being cooked,then maybe you could enjoy place.But if you want to read then bringaflashlight becuasethe lightingin ouronebedroom suite was so dim you couldnotpossilyread.the smellof ourneighbour'slver and onions dinner being prepared the first nighwe were there was quenauseating as it waftedthrougout oursuite. The hotel is in a notbad location ,within walkingdistanceof the oldcity and the satf was friendly and helpful.The suite wassaciousand saresly furnishedwith the sofa in the livngroom sporting a huge rip in the arm.It seemesfsirly new in outward apearnce but certinly needs improvement to get toa three satr rating.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: chaton2411
Reviews.Content: Very well located. We had a top floor suite, with one bedroom. Sofa bed was not comfortable at all for two, but we got a rollaway for one of the kids. Staff goes all the way to meet guests requests. Free laudry service and internet is a great plus for us!

Reviews.Title: “Renovations needed!”
Reviews.Author: Rossco814
Reviews.Content: Convenient location with a nice, friendly, helpful staff (most of the time). But the facility needs to be updated. Room was dark, drab. Air conditioner was within arms-length of bed and blew directly on bed, which was horrible. Felt like I was staying in a hotel circa 1999.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite”
Reviews.Author: tanlee
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for 2 nights. There were 3 of us in the suite and there was lots of room. The livingroom had a pullout couch. The kitchen was well stocked with all the utensils and dishes that were needed. The suite was very clean. Walking distance to Old Montreal, St. Catherine's St., Chinatown, St. Laurent st. bars were also closeby. Would recommend this hotel. Only downside is that parking is not included. $20/day is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay and big room”
Reviews.Author: Rosario_it
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at about midday from the coach station (10 minutes walking) and the room was already ready. Wat the difference between the hotel we had in Quebec and this one: the room was huge! The kitchen were fully equipped, there was some confortable armchair and bed qute big too. The service offered some other facilities: laundry, free rental of dvd and a business room with two PC connected to internet. We took advantage just of using the internet even thogh the connexion was extremely slow. The location is not bad and good to reach a lot of things on foot. The underground is not too far (5-10 minutes walking). Another advantage we found is that the hotel has some vending machines and moeover there is a shop "Couche Tard" just at 3-5 minutes walking. So the stay was really nice. I've paid this hotel with points + dollars (an option available with Priority Club).

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Missus_Bossy
Reviews.Content: This was my first Candlewood Suites stay and I was disappointed. The term "suites" did not match my experiences with other suites hotels where generally the sleeping area is in an other room (eg. Embassy Suites or Hilton Suites). A one bedroom suite at Candlewood means one room that is larger than the average hotel with a full kitchen. My friends and I booked two 1 bedroom suites on the same floor but when we arrived one room is considerably smaller than the other with no pullout couch and a very tiny kitchenette. We called down to the front desk and was told it was the only way we can be on the same floor. We asked to reduce the rate for the smaller room but they refused but was willing to move half of our party to the floor above us to get the larger room. Needless to say it was a bit of an inconvenience. The rooms were clean but very old. The air condition was very loud when it kicked in. They provided minimal toiletries and there was no daily housekeeping. If you needed fresh towels, you would have to bring your used ones down to the front to exchange for clean ones. The staff were friendly and helpful, fluent in English and French. It is located within walking distance to Chinatown and minutes driving to downtown core.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay!”
Reviews.Author: Wazari09
Reviews.Content: The great thing about this hotel are the rooms, which are very big, comfortable and always have a complete kitchen. This is very good for family travel, since you can make some food for the kids sometimes and have breakfast in your room. The room has a bedroom with a queen size bed and a living room with a sofa bed, both with TV. The downside is that they donÂ´t clean your room, so itÂ´s up to you to take out the garbage and make your bed. The location is very good also, very near Viex Montreal, and you have two subway stations some blocks away that can take you almost anywhere in the city. You also have a bus stop just in front. The staff is helpful and you can use for free the wifi internet, the business center with 2 computers and a printer and the laundry. The hotel also has a garage underneath for guest parking, but they charge $14 per day. The parking has an elevator, so you if you have a lot of luggage itÂ´s very helpful, since you can take them directly to/from your room floor.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, aged, surly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pradipd25
Reviews.Content: This was my first Candlewood Suites stay in quite some time, and it was a big disappointment. First of all, Priority Club Platinum members mean nothing to them. But then this is not surprising, since it means nothing to any of the hotels in the Priority Club. Secondly, the hotel does not offer daily housekeeping and you find out about this only at the time of checkin. There is no mention of this on the web site or in the reservation confrmation. The hotel itself, the rooms and the limited public areas, are extremely old, aged, tired and dated. They seem straight out of 1970s, 1980s, with fixtures and fittings that have not been updated since then. I had a 1 bedroom suite, and teh a/c worked only in the bedroom. There was no a/c in the living room, though the window opened, so it was not so intolerable. The wifi could be excruciatingly slow in the evenings and nights. Service is generally surly and indifferent. This was my 4th stay in a Priority Club hotel (Holiday Inn, Crown Plaza, Holiday Inn Express, Candlewood Suites) in Montreal, and it is best to avoaid them like a plague. They are badly in need of being shut down, totally renovated and fresh staff to be brought in. They need some serious remaking.

Reviews.Title: “A great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Talentimo
Reviews.Content: I visit Montreal regularly for business and this place suits my purposes perfectly. It's more like having your own apartment than a hotel. If you're looking for elegance and high service, this won't do the trick, but if you want a quiet, spacious suite with a serious kitchen, good fitness facilities in a good location at a reasonable price, you'll feel right at home here. Local phone calls & internet are free and the on-site store was handy and reasonably priced. There is a good IGA supermarket just down the street and it is only a few blocks to old Montreal, the metro lines, latin quarter and lots of entertainment. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “High value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Shinmiri
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Candlewood Suites Montreal back in April and felt the place is a very good value for the money. The hotel is definitely not for luxury stays but it's good for basic extended stays. The room was spacious and had a full kitchen. You have everything you need to make meals. China town is right across the street. I saved a lot of money on food from buying groceries from China town and making food myself. Everything is very clean in the room except the carpet which is my only complaint. I'd give this hotel a 4.5 but no half stars here so I have to give it a 4. Make sure you bring your own slippers if you want to stay here. My socks got very dirty walking on the carpet and wearing shoes in the room was generally very uncomfortable. Overall it's a very nice clean hotel that serve the purpose of extended stays. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is not seeking luxury stays.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: Kristin B
Reviews.Content: Service was fantastic - very friendly and helpful staff. Room was very clean and comfortable. Location was great - we walked just about everywhere we wanted to go. Huge bonus being able to make breakfast in the room each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good area, OK experience”
Reviews.Author: SydneyGigi
Reviews.Content: My Husband, daughter and I stayed at the Candlewood Suites for 3 nights in July. It was very good for access to Old Montreal and Chinatown, with a great shopping centre/ supermarket close by. The hotel we found to be more like renting a one-bedroom apartment, with an enormous kitchen with good facilities and quite a large bathroom. The hotel was very impersonal, and apart from the young man who checked us in, we were unable to get any help from the front desk staff who appeared to be busy at all times with computer work and unwilling to give assistance. As first time tourists in Montreal we would have appreciated some help! There was a smoky odour to the room but otherwise it was fine, and we were given a room with quite good city views as requested, nice for seeing the fireworks. The free laundry facilities were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: reesefortrees
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first night of our honeymoon and it was just a short walk to Old Montreal. The room was quite nice and clean, and we weren't expecting a full kitchen but it was a nice addition! The coffee pot broke but definitely wasn't as important as the location... and a pretty decent view out the window as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms for the Price”
Reviews.Author: missforetwenty
Reviews.Content: These rooms are massive! Most of them are like apartments. They come equipped with full kitchens and living rooms. We always bring our own food up when we stay at this hotel. It's a great way to save a little money instead of finding a restaurant. This hotel is a great location (walking distance) for any concerts you might be attending at Metropolis, L'Olympia, Foufounes Electronique, Place Des Art or Jacques-Cartier Pier. The valet parking is available at the hotel next door. Reasonable price and the garage is safe. The attendents I have dealt with were all very friendly. We are actually planning on booking this hotel again for a concert in October. The rooms could be upgraded/renovated...but that sort of thing doesn't really bother me. As long as it's clean and has a comfortable bed, I am happy.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Roque63
Reviews.Content: Last week we got to Montreal on a Family vacation We stayed at this hotel which is not your regular hotel, room service is not daily no ice maker machines,no cable tv . Room space are comfortable however needs a refurbish. Other facilities in the room such as kitchen area ,air condition are ok The best feature of this Hotel is that its walking distance to Chinatown , Old Port ,St Catherine and train station .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: GreenfieldMom6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 2 adults and 2 teen-agers in a 2 bedroom suite. The room was nice and large -- very nice to spread out. The only real complaint we had was the air conditioning. They have large AC units in the windows are the fans are very loud. We had to replace the batteries in the thermostat in the living room to get it to work properly. The kitchen was servicable, but the bathroom lacked any counter space. Again, the location was great! We could walk to a Metro station, and there was a grocery store just 2 blocks away. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite, Okay Overall”
Reviews.Author: sgkca
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2-bedroom suite with another couple for a weekend in early July. The suite itself was a little worn but it was very clean and it was huge. The living room was especially roomy and featured a couch and two leather reclining chairs, which were a great treat after wandering the city all day. Our only disappointment is that the kitchenette could have been better stocked with coffee, tea, and whitener. There was only two packets of coffee and since the room is not cleaned daily it would make better sense to stock up the rooms with such non-perishables. When we asked for more coffee the second morning the person at the front desk literally threw the packet at one of us. Note the they no longer have valet parking but a do-it-yourself parking under the hotel (off rue Hotel de Ville) for $18 per day. Oddly, there is also no ice machine in the building. You have to go next door to the Holiday Inn if you want ice. Again, considering this is a suites hotel this is a silly oversight. In terms of location you are ideally situated between Old Montreal (couple block south) and St Catherine Street (couple blocks north) as well as St-Laurent (couple blocks west), which takes you up to the Plateau neighbourhood. There is a Metro (subway) station within a 5 minute walk south.

Reviews.Title: “I missed my kids with the spacious suite with full kitchen”
Reviews.Author: Amigomo
Reviews.Content: Great view, great price, all things working, great kitchen, clean bath, great linens, Great staff,

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with good service...”
Reviews.Author: warriorliz
Reviews.Content: I actually really liked my room because of the kitchen and I could make a few things in there as well as boil water for tea etc. I have only one complaint and that is with the slow wifi. It says they have highspeed Internet but when I called the front desk they said they changed everything to wireless. But the wireless connection was pretty bad. They gave me the password for the holiday inn express which was the building beside and the connection seemed to be a bit better for some reason. Otherwise the staff was very friendly but I only stayed here because I have priority club points. I think all the decent hotels in Montreal are expensive and otherwise i would save money and stay in a b&b...which i did move to after 2 days as that is all that my points could get me.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious but very very average”
Reviews.Author: mikebrindle
Reviews.Content: We were 4 people in an appt with 2 bedrooms and sofa bed in living area. The appts are massive, so you've loads of space, even for 6 people but they are quite basic. Location is good for waterfront area and for chinatown and for outdoor concert area. Parking under hotel is 25CAD per night (but parking in Montreal is expensive anyway and you can come and go as you please). As long as you don't plan to stay in your room much it's OK. This hotel and HI in same building seems to be very popular with large groups of young people (although we didn't experience any noise problems etc). Montreal on a Saturday night is very very lively!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, no housekeeping, prepayment taken without notification”
Reviews.Author: luvroma2
Reviews.Content: We go to Montreal every June for the Grand Prix Formula 1 race. For some reason, the hoteliers have gotten together and decided that everyone who attends this race is a millionaire and as a result, they triple the normal nightly rate, require non-refundable prepayment, as well as a minimum stay. We booked this hotel in June 2010 at the rate of $132 Canadian per night, providing a credit card as a guarantee only, and with a 24 hour cancellation policy. The 2011 Grand Prix race dates had not yet been announced. When we checked in at the hotel June 9, 2011, we were told our credit card had been charged on May 11, 2011, for our entire 4 night stay, without having notified us of this. When we quetioned this change of the conditions of our (printed) reservation, we were told "this is the policy during the Grand Prix - besides you got a terrific rate - everyone else is paying at least $400 per night!!" Needless to say, we were not happy about this arbitrary change in the terms of our reservation contract and that our credit card had been charged without having been notified. The card we used to guarantee the room is not one we are currently using. Thankfully, it was still a valid credit card. Our room was a 2 bed suite with a small kitchette. At check-in, you are told housekeeping is only done weekly, so our room was not cleaned for 4 days. You could however, turn in soiled towels and exchange them for new ones. You can ask for shampoo and soap at the front desk. Shower caps are not available. There are free washers and dryers, but you must provide your own detergent. There is free internet, but it was so slow it was not worth even trying to connect. The location is good for sightseeing. Underground parking (which is shared by the Holiday Inn Express next door) is available for $18 per day - plus many, many taxes. Every available parking space was taken when we were there and I do not know where you would park if there was no space in the garage. The window air conditioner was quite noisy, making sleep difficult. This hotel was fine for our purposes at the rate we paid, but it certainly is not worth the over $400 per night the other guests were paying while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “would stay at hotel but would not go back to Montreal”
Reviews.Author: marieanddon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night. Easy to find, car park under hotel and costs. Free Wfif in rooms. Recption small but staff helpful. Room big, has kitchen area with fridge, microwave . Settee and Tv area. Plus 1 king bed with TV. Bathroom clean and large. Nice Hotel. Montreal would not be revisiting

Reviews.Title: “An Uneven Experience”
Reviews.Author: SongAndDanceDoc
Reviews.Content: Our first night's experience was befouled by a pervasive smell of vomit, emanating from the closet inside our room door, possibly from behind the water heater (an inaccessible space). Someone had even managed to get a metal jar lid into the garbage disposal in the sink. Spring break had been the week before our visit. There were no comparable rooms to rehouse us in that night, so we toughed it out. The next day there was reportedly an attempt to clean the room (unsuccessful) and then we were reassigned a larger suite (at no extra cost, other than the inconvenience of packing up and moving to the other room). Those rooms were very nice. The management were otherwise helpful as well, but should not have rented that room to anyone until it had been properly cleaned. There were good restaurants a few blocks away, as well as a shopping center, and the valet parking was efficient. So, I guess I can recommend this hotel, but not of you are arriving late, when the possibility of changing rooms is slim.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellinggirl1111
Reviews.Content: wonderful location in downtown montreal, the staff was pleasant and helpful, rooms were a good size and clean, my friends & I had a great time and would return

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mustlove
Reviews.Content: Big rooms and kitchen, clean, great staff and great location. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “No accountability”
Reviews.Author: Tsunami23
Reviews.Content: After realizing immediately upon checkout that I left 2 items of clothing in my room, I was given back a key to the room to get my items. The card key did not work after 2 tries. When the front desk clerk went to the room to take a thorough look, I was told my items were not in the room. I went home 2 hours away to then call the hotel and find out that my clothing WAS in the room. When I asked about the chances that the items could be courriered to me at the hotel's expense given that their clerk had failed to retrieve the items when there would have been no cost to either party, I was told it was my mistake for forgetting the clothing and that I should pay. I provided my information since it seemed I had no other choice if I wanted my items, and a month later I still do not have my clothing back. When I called the hotel to inquire earlier this week, they had no record of this situation and have not returned my call to date. The only saving grace is that they did not charge my credit card. The hotel agents I spoke to conducted themselves in an unprofessional manner. Too bad they haven't realized that customer service is so important.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy hotel-DO NOT GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: GUY-MKT-PROF
Reviews.Content: Stained carpets, zero maintenance, horrible smell mixed with unbearable insecticide odors. High risk for your health, DO not trust this establishment. I tried to cancel and be reimbursed upon arrival and was refused. This is really a ONE star hotel. NOT four. DO NOT TRUST THIS ESTABLISHMENT.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value for Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: citylover64
Reviews.Content: We stayed in your hotel from April 10-12. We found the location to be great for our needs as we wished to see the Old City and St Catherine's Street fot the shopping; this location was pretty much between the two which was perfect, The room was ample, especially the washroom and closet. The only complaint was we found it a little tricky to adjust the thermostat. Also, more current phonebooks would be helpful. The young men at the front desk were quite helpful in assisting us with maps and directions and when we asked Bianca for a recommendation for an Italian Restaurant she sent us to Napoli's on St Denis which was excellent. All in all a great stay at a reasonable price and would most definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and simple. Does the job.”
Reviews.Author: gonin60seconds
Reviews.Content: A clean, no-frills hotel that's perfect for a quick business trip. I know it's marketed as a longterm-stay hotel, but for me, the once-a-week housekeeping works only for a day or two. On my most recent stay, I had one of the smaller rooms rather than a suite. Clean and comfortable, it worked perfectly for one night, but it would not be ideal for a long stay. The closet door is blocked by one of the night stands, and for some reason the logical place for a closet is taken up by a hot-water tank. The TV is an old CRT and doesn't swivel. Valet parking, at the Holiday Inn Express next door, was smooth and friendly. For breakfast, I wandered around a bit and found a Press Cafe at the corner of St-Catherine and St-Denis. Wish there was something closer, but RenÃ©-Levesque is a wasteland.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean!”
Reviews.Author: major1018
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed for 1 night to go to a concert. The staff was extremely friendly and the room was very clean. The location was very close to the venue the concert was at, and it was also close to a lot of bars/strip clubs/restaurants, etc which was nice. We were late getting up the next morning, but the valet was nice enough to let us leave our car in the lot for an extra hour without charging us while we checked out and got brunch on St. Catherine Street. Overall it was great and I would gladly stay there again for a night or weekend trip.

Reviews.Title: “Room was great, except for the smell”
Reviews.Author: R0liver
Reviews.Content: We booked via Hotwire and were glad to get a room with a full kitchen. Unfortunately, despite the fact that is was supposed to be a non-smoking room, it smelled awful. Smells from adjacent rooms also came into our room. Our neighbour was definitely smoking not-quite-legal substances. When we got home, all of our clothes reeked of smoke - even the ones we hadn't removed from our suitcases. This hotel advertises free high speed internet access but it doesn't offer wifi and the wired connection was not reliable.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: truetous
Reviews.Content: The rooms and suites are spacious with full facilities. Absolutely top of the line in terms of room facilities. However, internet connection in the hotel was a disaster. Personally, I find this unacceptable in a hotel that adverstises itself as a long term property. Valet parking was slow. Business centre not well organized.

Reviews.Title: “Sound carries, sofabed was a joke, but otherwise the room was great”
Reviews.Author: jewels89
Reviews.Content: We booked through Hotwire and weren't pleased to get a queen and a double sofa bed for four people... then again for the price we paid, we weren't surprised. The queen was very comfortable, but the sofa bed was a joke - not only was it only a double, but it was soft and saggy. Thankfully I'd brought a pillow too, because the extra pillows were a little wimpy. The room itself was pretty great. Nice big bathroom, the room with the queen bed is nicely sized, there's a sitting area and two tvs. There's also a large kitchen (stove, dishwasher, fridge, toaster, coffee maker) which was great since we just went to the IGA a couple blocks down to make our own meals. Sounds carries in the hall though. We were fortunate enough to have a batch of drunken men come in around 2am which woke two of my friends up, and kept them up for awhile. I had headphones, so I slept through it. Location's pretty good - less than 10min walk to Berri-UQAM (bus terminal, main crossing point of the metro lines) and about 10min to rue Ste-Catherine for shopping. We'd probably go back if the price was right, just make sure there's no sofa-bed.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value!!”
Reviews.Author: hanahunny
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with Candlewood Suites. Very clean. Helpful staff and and a very short walk to the old town. I will stay there again, when I return to Montreal. Fabulous city.....

Reviews.Title: “Professional. The benchmark of hotel-chain accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Hammo123
Reviews.Content: Excellent service (trilingual lady on desk was an absolute pleasure to deal with), excellent room, great location, very clean, no noise. Also has the trademark (and well stocked) "Candlewood Cupboard", as well as the usual DVD rental. (Rooms have something like 30 channels anyway). The only negative was no wi-fi, however free high speed wired internet. Do yourself a favour and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great option for Montreal, especially if travelling with 4-6 people”
Reviews.Author: LondonJetsetter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a block away (5 min walk) from the nearest Metro station. There's many taxis passing by. The BIXI bike stations are never far away. The location is not super central, but still convenient for shopping, sightseeing and walking distance to China town and beyond to the Palais des Congres. You'll either do a lot of walking or spend some money on Taxis. The hotel does not have a lot of checkin staff, so it's usual to queue up a bit for service. They have a luggage room which is handy if you have a late flight out of Montreal - as they're strict on checkout times. We booked a two bedroom suite. It was perfect for our needs - four people travelling together. There is only one bathroom, two double bedrooms and a foldout sofabed in the lounge. The room has a full kitched (fridge/freezer, oven, stove, dishwasher, microwave, cutlery, crockery, loads of storage space). We got a pack of microwaveable popcorn in the microwave as a welcome treat. Theres a fairly large supermarket a few blocks away (Complexe Desjardins) to stock up on food/supplies - and a small facility off reception to buy the basics and stuff like ready meals. Room was clean and tidy and being high up we had good views back over Montreal. Take care with the slippery kitchen floor! The rooms have free, cabled internet access - network cable supplied. There's free WIFI in the lobby. The reclining lazy boy style chairs in the suite lounge are a nice touch. Loads of TV channels. The bathroom was a bit small and cramped considering it's a 2 bedroom suite that can accommodate 6 people. It's standard shower in bath, toilet and basin. Nothing special. No meals are offered in the hotel - it's self catering! If you need a bar/beer, there's a nice bar across the road at the Days Inn. No swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “sufficient for a group on a budget”
Reviews.Author: AWONGs
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights over the Sept long weekend with a group of 6. The 2-bedroom suite was spacious, though run down and really need new carpets. Not sure if its a Montreal thing but there were a ton of spiders everywhere we went. The staff was super friendly and called in to check on us once we got to our room. Water pressure in the shower was awesome. I would recommend this place if you're looking for something cheap to share with a group of friends rather than getting separate rooms. But you really have to accept the fact that this place isn't "hotel quality" and more like staying in an old apartment building.

Reviews.Title: “really nice place, but nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: purplefin
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in the heart of Montreal. You can walk to pretty much most of the local touristy things and areas. The suites are nice. They have a nice kitchen area, if you are staying for awhile. However, it is a chain hotel and there is nothing fancy about it. But, if you are traveling on a budget and not looking for anything unique, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A really good experience”
Reviews.Author: Super_Suzy2
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Candlewood Suites was extremely good. The rooms are spacious and have a separate bedroom and kitchen facilities. The staff were helpful both in making our stay comfortable and giving us tips on good things to see and places to eat. We really enjoyed our stay and would stay there again if we re-visit Montreal It was also good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Exactly What We Needed for Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: KAB323
Reviews.Content: We (family of 5 adults) stayed here in a 2-bedroom suite. While there were some minor complaints, we found the hotel to be a great value for our needs. For the price of one room, we were able to comfortable sleep 5 adults, have plenty of living space, and have a kitchen at our disposal. The location was fantastic; we were able to walk nearly everywhere, and it was a quick walk to the Metro for the few times we needed it. We had a nice view of Mont Royal and the cross, and if we opened the windows, got to listen to the jazz festival at night. Parking was very easy with the valet at the Holiday Inn next door. Upon arrival, the air conditioner was not working. Turns out someone had disconnected something before we arrived. It was fixed fairly quickly and we had no problems with it again. However, the second, smaller bedroom does not have an AC, and it was really warm in there. We were in Montreal during an unusually warm time, I think, but it did make it uncomfortable for the people sleeping in that room. The only other complaint we had was that the room had no hair dryer, though we had been told there would be one. This was quickly remedied when mentioned to the front desk- someone soon arrived at our door with one. Overall, it was a nice place to stay and fit our purposes well. We would consider staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price for spacious accommodations”
Reviews.Author: aggada
Reviews.Content: Big problems the first night with carousing high school graduates. Hotel security could not control the noise and running through the halls. Eventually the Montreal police arrived and kicked out the kids. Clean sailing after that. There is no breakfast included but the two-room studio is spacious and comfortable for a multi-day stay. Full sized kitchen equipment make eating the room possible. Parking arrangement with the Holiday Inn next door works out well. $18 per day with valet service and includes in and out privileges. We would definitely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this hotel choice!”
Reviews.Author: batesbon
Reviews.Content: Three of us traveled to Montreal to attend the F1 Race and were very happy with our choice of this reasonably priced hotel (I did book months in advance for this event). We stayed Jun 10-Jun 15; when we arrived, we found the hotel to be right on a main street, within walking distance of everything (Montreal is a "walking / bike" city). We took the Metro from the airport into town and was dropped off about 2 blks from this hotel. There are metro stations all around with a few blocks and we also took the metro over to the race. Now about the hotel. the front desk staff was always friendly and helpful as were the housekeeping staff. The rooms were sufficient for our needs; they were clean, adequate furniture, small kitchen with frig, stove, microwave, coffeemaker, dishes, etc.. We had a room facing the "courtyard" and it was relatively quiet; no complaints. The hotel had a small gym, free laundry room and a TV room with stallite TV. Again, we were very happy with our stay here, Montreal is a wonderful city; a mix of young and old - everyone was helpful and friendly and we felt safe at this hotel - it is not a 5 star area, but a great buy at the price, the neighborhood one street behind Rene Levesque Blvd is St Catherine's which is a bit "colorful" with an interesting mix of people, stores & eating; we still felt safe in spite of the mix of homeless, tourists & locals. The only few suggestions I would have - which I already shared via a hotel survey - is, this hotel could use a good coat of paint everywhere in the interior to freshen it up - and use a more vibrant color than the drab tan color on the walls now. The beds were a bit firm for us and the pillows a bit too soft - but no biggie. And last, the in-room TV had only very basic stations, and most in French; we had to go down to the hotel TV room to watch more satellite channels to get CNN and a familiar English speaking movie here and there - we weren't there to watch TV, but it would have been nice to get a few more channel in our room. Overall, a great hotel; we loved our visit to Montreal and this hotel and would definitely return to both!

Reviews.Title: “great location in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: jodon
Reviews.Content: A highly functional suite hotel on Rene Levesque in downtown Montreal, close to most attractions. Clean with a courteous and competent staff. Free internet and a good place to stay if you don't need the frills.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well appointed studio rooms in a colorful part of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: lwwylam
Reviews.Content: Candlewood Suites is an extended stay hotel designed for business travelers that provides full kitchens and clean, well-appointed rooms. The location is within easy walking distance of Chinatown and Old Montreal, but also just around the corner from an especially sketchy part of St Laurent and St Catherine, so watch your valuables while en route to the metro station and consider a taxi if you'll be coming back to the hotel late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: tropicaltravels6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a few days to be right in the heart of Montreal for some shopping and site seeing. He's from Montreal but wanted to check out another area of the city and we found this place. We always like to try and find places with kitchens if we can because it's really nice being able to buy groceries and have a fridge and somewhere to prepare food. We had made a reservation for a King bed suite and checked in to find that we only had a queen. We called the reception and were told there were none available so we asked for a suite with 2 beds instead just so we ensured we could both get a good nights sleep. The girl at the reception said no problem and we were moved to another room with 2 beds right away. This is a very convenient place to stay and a good deal for the money. We really enjoyed the beds too and were able to sleep peacefully here. The only thing we did not like is having to pay each day for valet parking at the holiday inn next door since this adds up and is kind of a pain if you want your car a few times a day. I'm sure we will stay here again if we come back to Montreal because it had everything we needed for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “second time.”
Reviews.Author: behindthesewalls
Reviews.Content: That was my second time at this hotel. First time was awesome. The suite was really big and new. But for this time, we didn't have the wifi. Only ethernet... We had two laptop and only one ethernet cable for the room. Also, room was smelling bad, small and look old as hell. My girlfriend rip her shirt in the bathroom... You can get way better in Montreal for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Spacious Room (Huge Actually as you can see in my pictures)!! Loved the kitchen and seperate bedroom!”
Reviews.Author: Meagan0146
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in this hotel and it was great! We had a corner hotel room (which are a little bigger then the rest) We had a long hall with a bedroom on the end (walk-in closet in the room), bathroom and 2 closets in the hall, Then if you walk past the hall a couple steps you come to the kitchen to the left (which has a nice suprise for you in the mircrowave so make sure you open it!) haha, straight ahead is a desk for your computer then to the left of that is a livingroom with a good size sofa bed and recliner chair. Every rooms comes with a DVD player. We had a great view of old Montreal from the 9th floor. The kitchen also had a bar like counter around it with 3 stools to sit around it. I could not have been more pleased with the value we got for our money. It was in a perfect location with ste. catherine street parallel behind the hotel, tons of restaurants and shopping on the street. (a suprising amount of erotic shops and strip joints tho) lol. Only about a 15 min walk to the Eaton centre and about the same distance to Schwartz ( a small very busy deli) but give it a chance, go in and theres great food, nice waiters and very fast service. My Boss is planning on visiting Montreal in a couple months and I will be recommending this hotel with 2 thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Average. Pure and Simple”
Reviews.Author: Gryphon7777
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Candlewood Suites Montreal for a few days back in May, as part of my trip around Eastern Canada. The room was certainly the most impressively sized, enormous in fact. There was a full kitchen, lounge etc. All in all, it had all the ingredients for a great hotel. I suppose what turned me off what the fact it was supposed to be a non smoking room (the whole floor was) but it just reeked of cigarette smoke. Everything did. I would walk into the room and want to turn around, the decor was fine, just the place smelled. Disappointing. The hotel was apparently full as well, which meant I was not going anywhere. The foyer also has as much charm as government motor registry office. In terms of location, it is also pretty average. Not really near anything - actually that's wrong, if you like the seedy part of Montreal (strip joints, dodgy take-aways) it is just a 5 min walk south. It is probably about a 20min walk through Chinatown to Old Montreal - which if you are a tourist, is pretty much where you want to be. The CBD area of Montreal is about a 30 min walk away. Again, kind of average. A large shopping mall (if you are into that sort of thing) is about a 10min walk. Overall, it is an average hotel. I had expected better. Next time i will spend just a few extra dollars and get something better...

Reviews.Title: “No problems at the Candlewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: Paxlulu
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in the staff informed me that they do not have daily housekeeping and that if I should require any extra supplies (sheets, soap, etc.) that I can get them from the front desk which is fine by me. My room was very clean and spacious. Free laundry room, a small gym and a small business centre are available on the first floor. The internet connection was a bit slow. Also, I found some of the corridors of the hotel had a cigarette smoke stench to them. That didn't bother me but it may annoy some guests. The location of the hotel is great. It's a few blocks to St. Catherine street, the closest metro station and China town. As well, it's about a 20 minute walk to the main train station in montreal. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “back again... and it's still the best value in Montrael suites”
Reviews.Author: marc-the-chef
Reviews.Content: Back for a second time. Rooms are a deal. For about $100 per night you can get a suite with a full kitchen (repeat: full kitchen, with full stove, oven, microwave, fridege, pots, pans, etc) 2 queen beds and a pull-out sofa, internet connections and the other usual amenities. Great for a family, and very clean and comfortable. The valet parking is about $16 ( a bargain compared to New York City) and you can get your car anytime durin gthe day. Only 2 blocks to Chinatown and inexpensive Asian food. Three blocks in the opposite direction and you're on St. Denis Atreet, the beginning of the Latin and Student Quarter, with dozens and dozens of eateries and night spots. We'll be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Blood on pillows”
Reviews.Author: TorontoJag
Reviews.Content: The worst stay we have ever had. there was blood BLOOD on the pillows, once we showed the manager he said there was nothing he could do, and then was rude to our entire party. housekeeping cleaned our room once during a 3 night stay and asked for a tip the day they cleaned it, never cleaned it again - i guess $10 wasn't good enough. there is security running around with their friends during the nights and treating guests like intruders. security also tried accuse us of stealing a laptop that they later found - "they misplaced it" but did threaten to beat us up with their frinds prior to finding it. don't ever stay here this hotel is not clean the staff are rude and the rooms are not worth the rates, valet is a joke, the only good thing about the trip was leaving this hotel for good.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Synsiya
Reviews.Content: What I liked: Location was great...walking distance from St Catherines and Old Montreal. It's on a street lined with hotels and its very quiet. I also got a corporate rate so it was really worth it for me. don't think its worth $170 per night which is the standard rate. What i didnt like: I had made 3 seperate bookings online. the night manager couldnt find one of the bookings. instead of creating a new one he said there was an issue with my booking and it may have not been completed (which isnt true since i had confirmation and the other 2 bookings were fine) and just nagged about it. What made it worse was it was 1 am and we had a 1 year old with us...he could have just created a new one. the other issue is that since each room has a kitchen we found that if your neighbours were cooking you would smell it throughout your room. unfortunately for us, our neighbours were always frying fish and smoking! I really liked the location so if you could find a hotel in the vicinity for cheaper, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at this apartment style hotel, free internet in the business center, laundry machines are free”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: Had a free night. Impressed with apartment style suite with full kitchen (although no dining table). Laundry machines are FREE! Ask for room facing the courtyard--very quiet. Great location just blocks to Old Montreal and downtown (without the high prices). Mostly a business crowd when I was there. Room furnishings a tad dated. Free internet in the business center. Great stay, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “good location, space, but kitchen poorly equiped and internet S L O W”
Reviews.Author: leedsflyer
Reviews.Content: Lots of room in the suite, and pretty well located. Valet parking via HI Express next door -- that worked ok, but sometimes had to wait a while for the valet. Reception desk at the Candlewood a bit understaffed, and although the kitchen had good builtin units (fridge, full cooker etc), it was difficult to make full use of them (e.g. no oven tray, or any oven proof dish, no sharp knife to chop vegetables...). The wifi was free but excruciatingly SLOW. Impossible to get more than one pillow for each of the four of us.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Waste Your Time, Go Next Door to the Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: Luv_Montreal
Reviews.Content: All I have to say is don't waste your time, The hotel is not worth your money. I have stayed at Candelwood hotels before and have had zero problems. The location of the hotel is good right near St Laurent ST. Check in was slow, only one guy was working which is sad for a Saturday. The service is HORRIBLE, I asked for some wine glasses at 3pm when I checked in. Didn't get them till 8pm after calling the front desk over three times. To top it off the front desk guy was rude about the situation. We requested a late check out, and when it was time, they claimed nothing was in the system. I warn you DO NOT valet your car with this hotel. We made that mistake and then found out that the valet was driving our car around in the parking lot, not only was he driving our car around. We saw him speeding around in the lot and smashed the bumper of one of the other guests cars. After reporting the incident to the hotel, all they could say was that they have warned the valet attendant before. We where furious and requested to speak with the Hotel Manager, so that he could see the attendant driving our car. We wee told that he only comes in on Monday and he would give us a call. We're still waiting for the call.

Reviews.Title: “Whoa, what a fire alarm system, and what a bunch of BS from the staff”
Reviews.Author: tuesdaysgone
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights and the first night after a long drive from Toronto we were evacuated for a fire alarm malfunction, Several hours later at 3 in the morning, again the alarm starts going. Again evacuated and scared and again several different stories as to why this is happening. At first it was acting up and malfunctioning and they were sorry. The next day after asking for 1 day comp we were told it was a customer hanging something that made the alarm go off. A different story with each employee. Needless to say 3 not happy customers.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad because of the location”
Reviews.Author: Elhajeb
Reviews.Content: Hi, this hotel is a bunisess service appartment type. You get a studio appartment with a small kitchen with microwave, oven and a fridge. You will get free access into the ground floor laundery room. You will be able to have your onw postsl box. The main strenght is the hotel is few yards from Saint Catherine China town and the latin quarter. So for us having a baby it was ideal to get by and of course the kitchen was a must. No breakfast service available. Abid

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mb-wv2008
Reviews.Content: Excellent location: walking distance to Chinatown, Old Montreal, St. Catherine St. shopping, IGA grocery store, Montreal Jazz Fest Room: We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite as a platinum priority club member. Very spacious with a separate living room and full kitchen. Room 1214 has a great view of Old Montreal and the river. Bedroom: comfortable bed. However, linens not as nice and comfy as a Holiday Inn Express. Bedspread was extremely heavy! Great for winter months, but too hot and heavy in the summer. Airflow from air conditioner was hitting our heads, so we ended up either sleeping with our heads on the bottom of the bed or we turned off a/c and opened windows. Bad thing with opened windows is the noise from the street, although this wasn't really an issue with us as we were at the festival till midnight and were usually dead tired when we got to the hotel, so we just slept thru the noise. Living room furnished with a sofa bed, a recliner and a desk. Kitchen furnished with a full size 4-burner electric stove with an oven, a full size refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, toaster, good quality pots and pan (one medium and one small pots and a medium frying/saute pan). Also provided are plates, bowls, glasses and eating utensils for two and basic cooking utensils. Nice layout with eat-in counter separating kitchen and living room. Amenities: Loved the free use of laundry facilities. The room even comes with a laundry basket. Exercise room equipped with basic equipment and was sufficient. Free DVD movies available at front desk. Safe deposit box available at front desk. Excellent free internet connection. Room serviced only once a week, but can exchange dirty towels for clean ones at front desk anytime. Excellent front desk service. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Unlike other Candlewood Suites, this hotel's front desk was staffed 24 hours. Valet parking is provided by the Holiday Inn Express next door. Overall, I love the "apartment" feel at this hotel and being able to cook our own food. This hotel is definitely my first choice when I am in Montreal for the Jazz fest.

Reviews.Title: “No room service but great location”
Reviews.Author: fkaway
Reviews.Content: This aparthotel from the Interconti hotel group without a restaurant is in the same building as the Holiday Inn Express, valet service provided by the Holiday Inn Express. Our quiet twin bed room on the 9th floor faced the inner court and was spacious with full size kitchenette and large bathroom. As thereâ€™s only room service once a week youâ€™ll get fresh towels at the front desk. Here youâ€™ll a helpful team and safe deposit box. It was ok for 1-2 nights. Thereâ€™s a small gym and a self laundromat at no charge. Location, location, location: only 10 walking mins. from the city hall and Old town. Lots of shops incl. Underground city and the metro station are just minutes away by foot. Next time Iâ€™d use a full service hotel or even the next door Holiday Inn Express even though our stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Frandis
Reviews.Content: This apartment style accommodation was very convenient and in a great location only 5 mins walk from the metro and the supermarket, ten minutes to the new port area with lots of restaurants, bars, shops etc. We had a 2 bedroom suite which was more than adequate for just 2 people (we were upgraded) good size kitchen, large bathroom, 2 double bedrooms and a spacious living room with TV, bed/couch and two leather reclining chairs, and free wifi internet. the staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a laundry free for guests use and also a small shop. They have a large lounge which we used after check out as we had a late flight. If you need to take the bus to the airport be aware that you take a smaller mini bus to the bus station where you then have to wait in a long line to get your tickets, make sure you leave plenty of time as the buses leave every half hour, on time and it took about 1 hour in the traffic to get to the airport. All in all a great stay in Montreal and we would return to Candlewood Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great room & location, service & ammenities could be better”
Reviews.Author: MammaMayhem
Reviews.Content: We are middle class 30-somethings who stayed here for a 1.5 weeks with two children under 5 and our dog. The room was comfortable and clean. The tub was extremely slippery even with a safety mat. My husband actually fell out of the tub/shower, not fun. You must restock everything on your own as rooms are supposedly cleaned only once per week. Ours was never cleaned until they came by while we were packing to leave (1.5 weeks mind you). There is no wireless, and the hotwire connection is super slow, but it does work. Our refrigerator didn't work so well and one of the burners on our stove was unplugged and very difficult to reattach. When we asked for replacement sheets and extra dishes (room comes with service for 2 only) it took 1.5 days and three requests to get them. The poor guy who brought them up was probably expecting a tip, but after rewashing our two cups so we could take turns eating and drinking i wasn't in the right mood for generous tips. Sorry Mr. All in all it's a good place for families with or without pets. It's not the Omni so you won't feel terrible if your children get a little loud. Also, parking is $4/day cheaper in the lot behind the hotel, but you have to pay each day by 10am or you could get a ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment style hotel”
Reviews.Author: waylaidback
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you like to make your own breakfast and want some space to stretch out. We had a one bedroom suite. Because it is an extended stay hotel, there is no daily room service, it is only weekly. If you want fresh towels you have to exchange them at the front desk. An IGA store is a few blocks away at the shopping mall, but there is also a small room at the hotel that has a small assortment of goods from toiletries to snacks for sale. It is connected with the Holiday Inn Express and that is here you have to park ($17/day). You park on the side street take your keys inside and the valet parks the car for you in the underground. It is not a fancy hotel but the kitchen has all you need to cook meals, and the bed is VERY comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Adequate - You Get What You Pay For.”
Reviews.Author: lanciak
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy, basic accomodation. Decent beds. Having the kitchen (as per all Candlewood Suites) is useful and there is a proper supermarket (IGA) a couple blocks away. The decor is dreary but the rooms are well sized. Lots of florescent bulbs which seems to becoming the Eco-conscious norm - but make everything look ugly. The fitness center is barebones, however for the gym minded there is a decent YMCA at the Dejardins complex two blocks west. 10-15 minute walk to Vieux Port, >10 minute walk to the UQAM metro stop (which accesses two lines). >10 minute walk to Gay Village. Parking situation is a little strange - Valet only which needs to be accessed via the Holiday Inn Express in the same complex next door. Business Center with desktops and printers is useful if you don't travel with a laptop and there is free hi-speed in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “It depends on what are you looking for”
Reviews.Author: MemberfromPadova
Reviews.Content: The hotel isnâ€™t that bad: spacious rooms with kitchenette, free internet and decent location. It is actually a good family hotel and even a decent value for money from this perspective. But I was travelling for business and have to say that this facility simply did not fit to my needs for the following reasons: â€¢ I checked in after midnight because of delayed arrival. I was sick tired and starving, but there was no restaurant, room service or any food to grasp. I had to get out and grab some fast food crap as the only available option. â€¢ The room smelt of cooked food and had to leave the window open. Luckily enough, it wasnâ€™t winter as yet! â€¢ The following day when I came back in the evening I found out that my room had not neem cleaned and made up. Overall, this hotel may be a choice only if you are looking for an inexpensive, well located family accommodation. Anything else is to be forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel let down by offhand staff”
Reviews.Author: MrKnolly
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel in February 2009 and had a bad experience. On arrival I was checked in to a room that was not yet made up and I made the mistake of not insisting on another room. Instead I unpacked in order to be able to re-use my shoulder bag (with reception's agreement and assurance that the room was just about to be serviced) and returned an hour later to find that it had still not been done and the chambermaid was just marking my property as having been left behind by the previous occupant. I found the reception staff offhand in dealing with this situation and generally a bit flippant. That said, this hotel has many good points, not least the size of the rooms and its convenient location, and I would give it another try provided it represented a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Joebaba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Candlewood Suites for 8 nights in November 2008, around Grey Cup. The location was really good â€“ two block walk to a subway line, 10 minute walk to Old Montreal, 20 minute walk to downtown, on a safe, busy street. Lots of restaurants within about a 10 minute walk. Our room was a small apartment, with a small, fully equipped kitchen. So compared to a regular hotel room, it was huge. You only get maid service once a week, but that was fine with us. The room was clean. The bedding was excellent, and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom towels were a little old and scratchy. Itâ€™s about 3 blocks to Place Desjardins, which is part of the Montreal Underground City. From there you can get downtown without having to go outside for more than half a block (though itâ€™s further than walking outside). So on colder days this is helpful if you still want to walk. The front desk staff was excellent. Checkin was quick, and they were always friendly and helpful. Our only complaint was that there is no wireless internet access in the rooms. And the wired internet was very slow at times. But al in all a great stay at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Downtown”
Reviews.Author: mayormcneilly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good location right in downtown. We were able to easily walk to St. Denis Str. and then over to China Town then down to the Old section of town on the River. Later we went back to the hotel and then out to dinner over on Cresent Street. The hotel is connected to a Holiday Express with the unique arrangement of having to get valet from there. The room was large with full kitchen that we didn't use. The property looks older with some recent updates. We were very happy with this hotel for use and would use it again when in the area next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience !!!”
Reviews.Author: DAVIDJORGE
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at the Candlewood Suites in Montreal Centre-Ville. Location was perfect and the room was very clean and comfortable. Staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware if you book the Candlewood on their own website!”
Reviews.Author: Patsje
Reviews.Content: We booked an one-bedroom suite in this hotel because we were traveling with our 14 months old son. The fact that it had a separate bedroom was the main reason for us to choose for the Candlewood. When we checked in, they put us in a small studio. When we tried to get that changed they said that this was not possible because they were full booked that night. Than we explained that we had a pre-paid reservation for an one-bedroom suite which we made on their own website and we traveled with a small child which had to be in bed at 7 pm and needed a two hour nap at noon. If we knew we got a studio we could have gone to another place. Eventually after a lot of discussion they allowed us to change to an one-bedroom suite the following night. They said they could do nothing about it and that they had this problem before with people who booked via their website! When we asked if we could speak to the manager they told us that the management was not in at weekends (it was a Saturday). When we returned to the desk on Monday they told us again that there was no manager on site. We wanted to get a refund, because we didnâ€™t get what we paid for. They guy at the desk who was really helpful (in contrary to the woman at the desk on Saturday) put himself to a lot of effort to get someone from the management on the phone. When he finally succeeded in that we had to do a lot of negotiation to actually get a refund. I think this is a shame, because they made the mistake. The rooms of this hotel are really good and the location is great, but because of the treatment we got we definitely will NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: kyyhky
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights; the room was large and clean and all the facilities provided (kitchen appliances, free internet connection etc.) were working as expected. The location is a short walk away from the city centre and right next to the chinatown. Since this is a suite-type hotel, it could be mentioned that there is a great large grocery store just two blocks away. The hotel staff wasn't the most competent; the handling of our problems (our reservation was set to start on a wrong day and during our stay, someone else had been using our parking slot, which they first tried to charge on us) could have been more efficient. On the other hand, both problems were solved with a few phone calls.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, good location, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Nosho
Reviews.Content: Good location and helpful staff- our room was not ready and we were given a better room on the 12 floor. Clean spacious room with LCD TV in each room. DVD Player and free movies at the front counter. Kitchenette with everything you need and IGA grocery store one block west on Rene Levesque.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: Kietfila
Reviews.Content: Candlewood suites is not like your typical hotel, it is designed for long term business visiters and therefore the accommodation is more like an appartment with a open plan kitchen and living room. housekeeping is only done once a week which was fine with us, theres no need to change linen and towels everyday anyway. My sister and I were happily surprised to see the facilities that each suite offers. The rooms are pretty clean & comfortable, fridge freezer, two large tvs, dvd in living room, towels, crockery and cutlery, microwave but not electric kettle, large desk, free highspeed internet in the room if you bring your laptop. You can also use the free business facilities if you don't bring your own computer. Free laundry facilities although you have to bring your own washing powder. Location was the absolute best. I can't emphasise enough that every single one of the front desk staff was extremely friendly, helpful and made you feel really welcome. They also have a small selection of dvds that you can borrow. The only slightly negative was the fact that the air con didn't work in the living room only in the bedroom. Otherwise, it was a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but definitely doable...”
Reviews.Author: smlivingston
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel from 6-27 to 7-2 2008 for the Montreal jazz festival. We used comp points from Holiday Inn's Priority Club program. Candlewood costs 15,000 points a night compared to the adjacent Holiday Inn Express which cost 25,000. Here are the positives of the hotel: -Location-10 minute walks to the old city, Chinatown, Jazz Festival, Latin Quarter, The Village and the Metro. Absolutely perfect location even though the area a block away is a little seedy, it was still pretty safe. My wife and I walked back from the jazz fest at 2:00 Am on more than one night so don't worry about the area. And yes you can find a hotel in a nicer section but probably not as centrally located. I can't stress this enough this is a great locale. -Front desk staff were very nice and accomodating. -The room condition-We had a newly renovated very large 1 bedroom suite on the 12th floor (room 1216). The room was in excellent physical condition with 2 flat screen TV's,DVD player, view of the beautiful City Hall in the view port section of the city, full kitchen. No mold or old and dilapidated furniture. The negatives: -The air conditioning unit is only in the bedroom. It is also a very loud machine. It cools off the suite if you turn it up high and leave the bedroom door open, but the bedroom will feel like Antartica. -No housekeeping, which is a facet of Candelwood's service. You will need to run down to the lobby for extra towels, soap or tissues etc. And you have to make your own bed (or not). -No ice machine on the Candlewood side of the hotel. You will have to run over to the Holiday Inn Express which is a seperate entrance in the same building. -No Breakfast bar but you could probably sneak into the Express and no one would know or care, or you could cook your own. Overall I would not hesitate to go back but don't expect the Four Seasons or the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “great solution”
Reviews.Author: cya
Reviews.Content: We recently vacationed in Montreal with our 18 year old son. We did not want to book 2 hotels rooms so when we found Candlewood Suites we went ahead and made a reservation. It was the perfect solution for us. My wife and I had a comfortable queen bedroom with 2 night stands, dresser, closet, window, AC and a LCD TV. Our son in the lounge area had a nice sleeper sofa, another larger LCD TV and DVD player. There were 2 -leather like, full recliner, chairs and end table. A lanai and window faced the old town and port. The bathroom had a full size shower/tub. There was also a fully furnished kitchen with refrigerator, microwave, cooktop, coffee maker, dishes, pot and pans. An eating counter and bar stools too. On the ground floor (RC) rez des chaussee is reception, business center (free internet and printing), laundry, and exercise room. The place was very clean, and conveniently located. The Holiday Inn Express, their sister property is next door. 5 minute walk to the old town, it borders Chinatown, 10 minutes to downtown and 15 to the train station. Nice IGA supermarket 3 blocks one direction, small grocery store 2 blocks another. Neighborhood surrounding is not great but it was OK, we felt safe at all times. Donâ€™t book it if you want a luxury hotel experience with nice amenities, full service, bell hops etc. There is not daily maid service. Book it if you want a clean, conveniently located hotel with lots of room. A real value here.

Reviews.Title: “new years amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: ms_turee
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 2 times..n its always been a good stay...very clean...very roomy...extremely friendly staff that are always willing to help...we had 7 people in the room for new years when maximum was 4...and never got noise complaints...its full of teens and party people so if you want a fun place stay here. First time I stayed we were loud but we just got a warning from a really nice security guard...Next time I go to Montreal im staying here again..

HotelInfo.Name: Candlewood Suites Montreal Centre-Ville
HotelInfo.Address: 191 Rene-Levesque Blvd E, Montreal, Quebec H2X 3Z9, Canada
